title: Knowledge Check

questions.text: What does VLA stand for in the context of robotics?
questions.explanation: VLA (Vision-Language-Action) refers to systems that integrate visual perception, language understanding, and action execution in robotics.

questions.text: How do LLMs (Large Language Models) contribute to robotic systems?
options: They provide high-level task planning and natural language understanding
questions.explanation: LLMs provide high-level cognitive planning and natural language understanding, allowing robots to interpret complex commands and plan sequences of actions.

questions.text: What is a key challenge in Vision-Language-Action systems?
options: Generating enough power for robot operation
Coordinating between perception, language understanding, and action execution
questions.explanation: The main challenge in VLA systems is effectively coordinating between visual perception, language understanding, and action execution to achieve coherent robot behavior.

instructions: Select the best answer for each question. You can review your answers after submission.
